oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Pommel holsters
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Pair of leather pommel holsters with brass tips. The holsters belonged to Gen. George Dibrell, 8th (also 13th) Tenn. Cav. Regt. The unit, referred to as the "Independent Partisan Rangers," was composed of 921 men primarily from White, Putnam, and adjoining counties and was part of Gen. Nathan Bedford Forrest's command early in the war.
